alert.note: Alert for Orange (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 02 at 3:51PM EDT until April 02 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN ORANGE AND NORTHEASTERN OSCEOLA COUNTIES... At 350 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Wedgefield to 6 miles east of Narcoossee to 6 miles southwest of Harmony, moving east at 30 mph. The storm just south of Saint Cloud could produce hail up to golf ball size or larger, take cover in Saint Cloud. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Orlando, Saint Cloud, East Lake Toho, Holopaw and Narcoossee. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
